title: Ivan Albright at the Art Institute of Chicago Postcard Book
description:
This book of 31 postcards presents a selection of the Art Institute’s extensive collection of work by native Chicagoan Ivan Albright (1897–1983), whose painstaking and ghoulish painting style has both shocked viewers and earned him a loyal following. Highlights include Picture of Dorian Gray and other visitor favorites as well as a series of incisive self-portraits

  • Dimensions: 6.5 x 4.75 in.
  • 31 postcards
